alert.note: Alert for Larimer; Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 9:26AM MDT until May 12 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Colorado, including the following counties, in north central Colorado, Larimer. In northeast Colorado, Weld. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry creeks. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 924 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated long duration moderate to heavy rain due to showers. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Rain will decrease later this morning although the water will remain high through the afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eastern Fort Collins, Greeley, northeastern Loveland, Brighton, Windsor, Evans, Firestone, Frederick, Fort Lupton, Milliken, Lochbuie, Eaton, Dacono, Severance, Platteville, Hudson, LaSalle, Ault, Kersey and Gilcrest.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
